content.title: Financial Assistance To Pre-primary School In Remote Areas
content.beneficiary: Pre-primary schools in remote tribal areas
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance to Pre-Primary School in Remote Areas' by the Department of Tribal Welfare, Government of Goa provides financial assistance to set up pre-primary schools in the remote tribal areas which lack the facility of pre-primary education for the tribal population. Financial assistance in the form of rent amount payable for the premises, fixed remuneration to one Teacher, one helper, teaching aid/equipment, toys, and mid-meal will be provided under this scheme.
benefits: Up to ₹ 2,000/- per month recurring expenditure for rent depending upon the quality of the facility.
₹ 300/- per month per student as refreshment expenses.
Fixed Amount of ₹ 25,000/- for teaching aids/toys and other teaching materials for the first year.
₹ 15,000/- per annum for toys and other teaching materials for the next four years.
Fixed Remuneration of ₹ 10,000/- per month for Trained Teacher (₹ 8,000/- per month if untrained) with a 10% annual increment.
Remuneration of the Helper as per the Minimum Wages Act.
eligibility: No pre-primary school should exist in the locality.
The school should have at least ten Scheduled Tribe (ST) students in a class of twenty (20) students.
Educational Qualification/Training for the Trained Teacher as per the Education Department's requirements.
If no trained teacher is available, an untrained teacher may be appointed, who must obtain necessary qualifications within three years.
content.application_process: Offline. Interested persons/agencies should visit the Department of Tribal Welfare, Govt. of Goa, Shram Shakti Bhavan, 5th Floor, Patto, Panaji-Goa, - 403 001. They must fill out the application form and submit it along with required documents.
documents_required: NOC / Lease agreement of the owner of the premises.
List of Scheduled Tribe Students in prescribed Proforma.
Details of the Teacher/Helper in the prescribed proforma.
Application for registration of Pre-Primary School with the Education Department.

faqs.question: Are untrained teachers considered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: While trained teachers with the required qualifications are preferred, if no trained teacher is available in a specific locality, the Government might consider appointing an untrained teacher.

faqs.question: Is there a provision for incremental increases in the remuneration of trained teachers?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme incorporates an incremental increase of 10% in the remuneration of trained teachers every year, subject to their satisfactory performance.

faqs.question: Could you explain the remuneration structure for trained teachers and helpers?
faqs.answer: Trained teachers are provided with a fixed remuneration of ₹ 10,000 per month. Helpers' remuneration aligns with rates set under the Minimum Wages Act.

faqs.question: How are teaching aids, toys, and other teaching materials supported under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme allocates a fixed amount of ₹ 25,000 for the first year for teaching aids, toys, and other materials, and ₹ 15,000 per annum for the next four years.

faqs.question: What provisions are made for refreshments for students in pre-primary schools under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme allocates ₹ 300 per month per student for refreshment expenses.

faqs.question: Could you detail the rent assistance provided to schools under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides recurring rent assistance of up to ₹ 2,000 per month, depending on the quality of the facility.

faqs.question: Which department manages this scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme is managed by the Department of Tribal Welfare, Government of Goa.

faqs.question: Can NGOs also apply to this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, NGOs with three years of experience in managing pre-primary schools are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Does this scheme accept online applications?
faqs.answer: No, as of 18/08/2023 this scheme only accepts offline mode of application.
